Israel

sourceDesc.p: Written by Office of the Historian staff, November 2008

div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized Israel as an independent state on May 14, 1948, when President Harry Truman issued a statement of recognition following Israel’s proclamation of independence on the same date.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Israel, 1948.
div.p: The United States recognized Israel as an independent state on May 14, 1948, when President Harry Truman issued a statement of recognition following Israel’s proclamation of independence on the same date.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations, 1949.
div.p: Diplomatic Relations were established when U.S. Ambassador James Grover McDonald presented his credentials on March 28, 1949.
